Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, take a look at this.
Hm? What is this?
I have made a list to ensure everyone, at all times, follows our virtues! I will be posting these fliers all over the destroyer after today's battle.
Roeder, there are over twenty virtues! They don't have time to read and abide by all of this.
If they can rally together to attack Nixen this fast, they will have no problems. It's practically what it means to be a decent person.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose the crew can learn...

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, now pay attention...
That is irrelevant.
I knew you would follow my lead, Herr Kapitän.
The first virtue you need to learn is...
*ALARM*
Oh, thank the stars! Morganas!
Aber... we are not through here, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I found you.
So you did - but I'm afraid we don't have time to learn Prussian virtues right now.
We learn by doing, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Phew, I wasn't sure we would get out of that alive...
What's wrong, Roeder?
Kapitän, you recruited me, a Klasse 1936 Zerstörer. You cannot ignore my demands. Stop acting like there is no price to pay for my service!
You have a point...
Look at that! Treue, and now  Bescheidenheit. Loyalty, humility - you are learning quick, Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: How many more do I have to learn!?
Are you doing this to everyone?

Fields.DialogueText: I assume that tone of voice was enthusiasm.
Do not worry over how many are left. Look forward to them with eager expectation.
Only to the stubborn.
Soon, with my guidance, you will be a shining example of Prussian virtues to the crew, Herr Kapitän.
Why are you so obsessed with the virtues anyway?
Because...!
*ALARM*
Roeder? What are you doing out here, staring out at the ocean?
Aufrichtigkeit. Sincerity. A vital Prussian virtue. I will have to tell you the truth...
Hm?
Is this a joke to you?
What?! Are you mocking me?!
Are you mocking me? Are my values funny to you?
... Forgive me, Kapitän. I'm needed on the bridge.
Roeder, wait!
... She's not the type of Belle to laugh, is she?
*ALARM*
On cue, huh?
@BATTLE
We are under attack! Everyone, move! We have no time to waste!
@BATTLE
Augh... I told those imbeciles down at the port to check the durability before we left.
Did you check the hull before we left port?
... That was the crew's job too.
But you are also the spirit of this ship! Checking your own status should be easy!
Do not act like you know how it is in my ship! Try being a Walküre  and having to constantly monitor everyone's status!

Fields.MenuText: I'm worried just as much as you are.

Fields.DialogueText: You lack restraint when you talk to your Schiffsdame. I will gladly circle that virtue on the list.
Courage to back down when you know you can't win. You are the breath of the Prussian virtues and I couldn't be prouder.
Just as much? I think not. You are not a vessel supporting hundreds of lives.
So oder so, I made it known to the crew. They are mending the hull as we speak.
Well... good.
You summoned me?
I have decided that from this day forth, we make a concerted effort to be more disciplined.
Discipline? From the Prussian virtues, correct?
Yes. From now on, we're reducing rations of schnapps and beer.
Was? What?!
It's fairly obvious that alcohol causes a noticeable decrease in alertness in the hours following consumption. We must be ready for an attack at all times.
Are you insane?!

Fields.MenuText: Can't you be happy with anything I do?!

Fields.DialogueText: Well... no, but...
Er, it is nothing, Kapitän.
No!
Oh, the Morganas. Don't worry, Roeder. I'll make you and the crew proud!
... Das ist Wahnsinn...
@BATTLE
I've noticed we've also been fairly extravagant with cheese. And we have wine stockpiles that would be the envy of a number of French ships. We need to simplify, I think.
Morganas! They're coming in!
Let's see if they can handle my Zielstrebigkeit.
@BATTLE
Oh, my... Fräulein von Roeder! You were amazing out there! It was a true honor to be in your presence.
Danke. And good work during the fight, Seemann!
Your popularity is rising, I see.
"Rising?" Nein. People are always in awe of me. I am used to it, but I try not take it for granted.
Why is that?
I do not wish to talk about it.
If I, Diether von Roeder, say "I do not wish to talk about it," then I advise you to not speak.
You still lack restraint. We are done talking.
Good answer.
Suave move.
Yoi!
Roeder?
Wallsu dinks Schnappes inde Kabinett hyden to cannen.... willsusss nich far maken in grill warfare!
First, I find your ability to properly pronounce "Schnaps" and war terminology while slurring all other words strange and amusing.
Der poin'is, Tilsiter is de beste schieß!
No one said that, Roeder.
Dan thell moi. Was yur favrite?
My favorite cheese?
Holes! Too many holes! Dey je'esmal shitt ju um haff de schieß!
Strunk cheese. Strunk schieß! Lyke ju, gäbbn!
Wuaaaaaaaaat?!
*ALARM*
...Oooh... alarm!
Well, this has been a delight, Roeder, but I think I'm going to find an officer to escort you to somewhere a bit more out of the way.
Shuwsh!
@BATTLE
Shuwsh yourself. Engelke!
Kapitän?
Find her a place to sit and get her about a bathtub's worth of coffee. We're going to need our ship lucid.
Kapitän, a word?
What is it?
What would you say if... never mind. Nixen are approaching from the south.
@BATTLE
Ah, Kapitän. Forget what I was saying earlier.
I know one of the virtues is restraint, but this isn't the time to be showing that off, Roeder. Speak your mind.
Sie haben Recht, Kapitän. As I was saying, what would you say if I told you I descend from a noble lineage?
I would say... I knew as much the minute I saw you. You do have a certain air of superiority and dignity.
Ist das so? So you do not see me as... different?
Hm, I guess you don't understand.
Reliability. I do insist that you tell me what is on your mind.
...Is that supposed to be a compliment?
I'm sorry, Roeder. I just don't know how to respond to that.
There is a time and a place to show honesty, but... I do wish you were straightforward when it comes to my feelings. Learn that virtue well.
Grrr...
Something the matter?
Little... someone keeps ripping the Prussian virtues fliers off the ship! They act like I do not know what is going on! I am the Zerstörer!
At ease, Roeder. You have to maintain your discipline, otherwise it will bring the morale down. Remember, that is one of the virtues.
Vielleicht, aber... wait. Oh... I know where you are now, you little... By the way, Nixen are coming from the east.
Roeder?
@BATTLE
Found him! And this sailor that said it was an "honor" to be in my presence! Unbelievable!
Engelke? Why did you do it, sailor?
Do you understand the pressure she puts on us to follow these virtues? Our lives are constantly on the line, and during the few moments of rest we have, she's pushing these on us!
You've made a big mistake crossing paths with me. If I see you do this again, don't be surprised to find yourself overboard!
Engelke, you're dismissed. Roeder, take a breath.
Machen Sie sich keine Sorgen, Kapitän. I promise, I won't drown him, even if he does pull down my virtues again.
Wh-what? You seemed pretty serious a second ago.
No man is worth losing. No matter how despicable.

Fields.MenuText: You have to own up to your word, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: For a human, I suppose it does not.
Order. That is what I have to maintain with this crew. If fear is not instilled in the crew, they will all be lost.
Sense of duty prevents me from injuring that man, even though he deserves it.
If only everyone could see the value of those virtues– like you, Kapitän.
Roeder? Wait!
Kapitän, there is something you should know.
Hm? What is it?
There...
Roeder?
... some...
... some...
... Nixen to the east.
Oh, come on, now. I thought you were telling me something serious!
The Kapitän makes forced attempts at Humor and expects me to laugh. I try the same, and no one laughs. Das ist nicht gut.
@BATTLE
The part about the Nixen is true, though.
Why were you trying to make me practice a Prussian virtue if you can't follow through with it?
I am a ship. I am not perfect.
You know... I'm not sure why I was attempting to hold you to a higher standard, but I suppose that's fair.
Besides, if I follow through with most of the challenging virtues, I deserve to treat myself to something delicious now and then.
Is there a food in particular that you've been wanting for a while?
... Ja, actually. Knieperkohl.
Isn't that...
Pickled cabbage? Yes, it is.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, I don't do well with things that are... pickled.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Not many find it as appealing as I do.
An old one, handed down to me, and me alone.
It might be an acquired taste for you, Kapitän.
Anyway, I am not sure you would like it, to be honest. My recipe is stronger than most.
I am curious about it, though. Maybe the next time we're near Germany, we can arrange to have the ingredients brought on board.
Agreed.
*ALARM*
Augh. The alarm. It's time to go to work.
Ja, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
... From whom?
Don't distract me as I work.
It's a legitimate question.
Nein. It is not.
But...
Let's see a little more muscle! We can't let those Schiffsdamen see we are lagging behind!
Yes, Schiffsdame!
Nixen on the horizon! Follow my lead and we will all live to drink again!
@BATTLE
Roeder, why were you working the crew so hard?
I need to keep my head above the other Schiffsdamen, and do my nation proud.
But you don't have to work yourself – or my crew – so hard.
If I don't push them, who will?

Fields.MenuText: I will. I am the Captain, Roeder.
You're not in this alone, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: You are not of my lineage. Step aside.
I will always be alone. You will understand that, Kapitän.
I will "calm down" if I am rotting at the bottom of the sea! There is never a time to relax!
I'm just trying to understand you, Roeder.
Kindly cease talking and get out of my way. There is work to be done.
We'll see if she's this haughty after I hide her cheese.
After I rip these Nixen to shreds, I will delight in my Gorgonzola!
@BATTLE
You hid the cheese again, didn't you?
You were barking at the crew again, weren't you?
You know cheese is one of my only pleasures. Is it in the back of the freezer again?

Fields.MenuText: You could always check the starboard side.

Fields.DialogueText: Trying to be sly with me, I see?
Where is your loyalty?!
You're not leading me on another fruitless escapade, Kapitän.
Genug! I will go find it myself.
Good luck!
And bear in mind - if that fine cheese is not anywhere on the ship, do not be surprised if you find yourself swimming in burning seawater.
Duly noted.
... Okay, she might actually kill me if she finds out I dumped it all overboard. That's fun.
Kapitän, I have something I must ask.
Speak up.
Nixen are approaching. Das ist jetzt nicht der richtige Zeitpunkt.
@BATTLE
Have you lost anyone before?
You mean the crew?
No... I mean... dear family.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't like you. What's going on?

Fields.DialogueText: That... must have been difficult.
You are fortunate, Kapitän.
I am just... thinking.
What if you didn't know where they had died, exactly?
Roeder... please be straightforward with me. What's going on?
... I apologize, Kapitän.
Roeder! I've finished posting the virtues around the ship!
Ja? Did you now? Danke, kind sailor.
You are most welcome, Schiffsdame.
Wait. That was the sailor from before, Engelke – the one who took them all down. How did you manage to patch things up?
I would call it Dienstbeflissenheit. Sense of duty. If a member of my crew addresses his failings, I would be remiss if I held a grudge.

Fields.MenuText: But you didn't have to be quite this... friendly about it.
... I don't know what to say.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja... you could say that.
Nein, I did not have to. But, sometimes sincerity goes a long way.
There is nothing to say over such an act.
He will owe me a favor in the end.
Ah, so that's it, then...
I'm afraid you have the wrong idea... Augh, the Nixen are approaching.
@BATTLE
What's wrong, Roeder? Why are you... looking at me like that?
... You are going to pay...
Oh, boy. Oh, look over there! Morganas!
You better hope you perish in battle, because that will be a far more palatable fate than what I have waiting for you!
@BATTLE
You lied to me!
In my defense, I legitimately thought that cheese was moldy.
Kapitän! Gorgonzola is an aromatic delight and, when paired with the right wine, a delicacy of which you've never obviously partaken!
Well... is there anything I can do to make it up to you?
We are heading to port. You will secure me new cheeses. And you will give me no speech, telling me I'm failing to live up to my virtues.

Fields.MenuText: But really... what about your virtues?
Only as long as you keep that cheese away from the kitchen.

Fields.DialogueText: Ruhe!
Niemals. Never.
Betrayal has its consequences.
You are the one at fault for throwing away such a prized commodity. Good day, Kapitän!
... Why wouldn't she answer those questions?
What are you mumbling to yourself?
You want honesty? All right. I've been trying to better understand you, but you refuse to answer certain questions about yourself. I want to know why.
Is it not enough that you know I come from a dignified family?
That is not what I mean and you know it, Roeder.
Nein. I do not.
Und?
Why should I? You are not the easiest person to confide in.
Gut. Very good.
Are you done? The Nixen are coming. Prepare yourself.
Roeder, wait! You dropped this... What is it?
Just an old memento.
What are you hiding, Roeder?
@BATTLE
Kapitän.
Hm?
Do you remember when you made a joke of what I was trying to say? I said, "I'm..." and you filled in with a quip of your own?
I do. What about it?
None of your guesses were wrong. There... I've been partially honest.
You are not fully honest? What do you mean?
At times, I fail at the Prussian virtues. So much so that... well, I'm a disappointment to my ancestors.

Fields.MenuText: I don't understand how that could be.
Only when you're drunk, I'd say.

Fields.DialogueText: It... it doesn't matter.
Perhaps it isn't for you to understand.
Ja, I'm well aware that my behavior following drinking leaves something to be desired.
The Nixen are approaching. You will understand soon, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
All right, we're set!
Was? What are you doing?
Heh, I'll explain later. We have company.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, what were you going to say?
I memorized all the Prussian virtues!
Ist das so? Can you name them all in alphabetical order?
Roeder, please. I am just a beginner.
I am teasing. Let me hear it.
All right!
Hm?
Um...
Stage fright?
Heh, I may be too soft if I let this slide.
If the crew saw this, they would have abandoned ship!
Only the strongest can truly breathe in the Prussian air.
If my ancestors were around, they would have slapped your wrists thrice!
A bit harsh.
I am not my ancestors, however. You will recite it to me when you are more comfortable. In the meantime, keep practicing.
Yes, Schiffsdame.
Kapitän, we have Nixen approaching.
They just won't let up, will they?
Also... I smell something.
Heh...
@BATTLE
Did you get the cheeses?
Yes, I did! gorgonzola, gouda, blue cheese, brie... all the good stuff!
Sehr gut! I am... impressed.
That said... I know too much about cheeses now.
Why is that?
The merchants kept rattling on about which cheese is best to be melted slowly on the tongue, which is good for certain meats...
Ha, this is what happens when you throw good gorgonzola off the ship, Kapitän.
Grah. Yeah, I'm sorry about that.
Worry not. You have proven yourself with reliability. Another Prussian virtue!
Loyalty... how charming.
More and more, you are becoming like my ancestors.
You will learn them all until your brain bleeds.
Huh?
Oh, it is nothing, Kapitän.
Roeder, I've been meaning to ask...
Was? What is it?
Augh, hang on. I see Morganas approaching us, Roeder.
@BATTLE
Why do you ask that?
Don't take this the wrong way, but you were just talking to him. And it looked like a real conversation - you usually keep more distance between yourself and the crew.
It's not as though we're planning to holiday together. You're making something out of nothing.
Okay.
Except for the fact that he has repaid the favor I did in not hurling him overboard. Behold my prize.
Oh, that on of a... How did he find that bottle of wine? I could have sworn I had found the perfect hiding place.
You cannot hide this good pinot noir away from me! The sailor came through after all!
That is the beauty of it all, Kapitän!
Yes, this again! It will always be "again" until you realize the error of your ways!
Because it is liquid joy!
Your hiding spots are ridiculous, by the way.
Maybe they're so subtle that they just *look* ridiculous. Maybe this was all part of my cunning plan to make you forge human connections with your crew.
Hey.
"Hey?"
I know, I know. Too informal, my sense of order is lacking - or something. Set that aside for now.
If I must. But you-
I know. I'm terrible.
But I was wondering what's going on with you and Engelke. Have you managed to reform him?
Fine. I'll work on better hiding places.
Ancestors....
Hm?
That's the memento you dropped, isn't it?
Ja.
May I ask more about it?
Ja, natürlich. This was a memento from my ancestors. It is a locket, that when opened, has the list of all the Prussian virtues.
Is that where you find your motivation?
Ja, Kapitän. Without these virtues, I'm sure I would have died, by now. The crew as well...
Thanks for listening, Kapitän.
Hm? "Why" what?
Well...
Nixen from the north. We should go, Kapitän.
Yes, Schiffsdame.
@BATTLE
Roeder! There has been an ambush!
Oh, why now?!
That's rhetorical, right?
Tcht. You don't have time to be impudent right now!
@BATTLE
That is it! Genug!
What's wrong!?
I have had it with this war!
What happened? Calm yourself, Roeder.
*sniff* Karl!
I don't know who you-
Engelke. He did not make it... In that ambush, the ship swayed a bit too much towards port. He took a direct hit. It was an accident.

Fields.MenuText: At least he wouldn't have suffered.

Fields.DialogueText: It is not your fault, Kapitän.
Tcht. Nixen... they so thoroughly irk me, Kapitän.
It's nice to think so.
He was my friend, Kapitän. Besides you, my only friend.
I'm sorry.
Tcht... I do not want anyone else to die. Everyone! Stop dying!
Roeder?
*sigh*
Are you okay? If you want to talk...
Karl...
Roeder...
That man... was the first to defy me. But... he was the embodiment of the Prussian virtues in the flesh. Something I failed at, as you know.
What are you doing, Roeder?
His body... here... they have to cast it off. Please. Help me push it overboard.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you'll smile again, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän.
True, but you are also a part of this ship. Please, help.
... Someday, I might.
(later) It is done...
I'm sure he'll be at peace, Roeder.
Ich hoffe es.
@BATTLE
There are Nixen to the west. Can they not even allow us an hour to mourn?
There's a half finished bottle of schnapps. But where's Roeder?
Ich bin hier, Kapitän.
Waugh! Please approach me without frightening me, if you can.
You asked where I was, so I appeared. Is that not enough?
What's going on? Please, be straight with me, Roeder.
I told you I was a disappointment to my ancestors, remember?
Yes...
There is immense pressure on me to be loyal to Prussia. Or what is left of it, I suppose. But more and more, I find myself opposed to the Germans and, thus, Prussia.
My ancestors would be thoroughly disappointed with my rebelliousness.
Roeder... I can do little to affect your family's opinion of you. But as long as you're on my team, I don't care where your national loyalty lies.
Your strength means the world to me, and in spite of your rather severe standards, you've never disappointed me.
Danke, Kapitän. That... that means a lot to me.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. We should probably go.
All right.

Fields.MenuText: She's a lot to handle, but I'm glad she's on my team.
